articles.title: Treaties Signed between DPRK and Russia
articles.content:
Treaties Signed between DPRK and Russia
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A treaty on mutual legal assistance in criminal cases and a treaty on extradition of criminals between the DPRK and Russia were signed in Pyongyang on Nov. 17.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were President Pak Myong Chol and other officials of the Supreme Court and from the Russian side the delegation of the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation led by Minister of Justice Alexandr Konovalov, Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					 They were inked by Pak Myong Chol and Alexandr Konovalov.

articles.title: Delegation of Maritime Administration of DPRK Leaves for UK
articles.content:
Delegation of Maritime Administration of DPRK Leaves for UK
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Maritime Administration of the DPRK led by Director Jon Ki Chol left here Thursday to attend the 29th Assembly of the International Maritime Organization to be held in London.

articles.title: WPK Central Committee Hosts Reception for Cuban Ambassador
articles.content:
WPK Central Committee Hosts Reception for Cuban Ambassador
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) Thursday hosted a reception in honor of the Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK German Hermin Ferras Alvarez and his wife and staff members of the embassy.
					
					 Secretary Kim Yang Gon and Vice Department Director Pak Kun Gwang and other officials of the C.C., the WPK were present there.
					
					 Kim Yang Gon said in his speech that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation based on the special comradely relationship between the preceding leaders of the two countries are invariably growing stronger.
					
					 We will struggle shoulder to shoulder together with the Cuban comrades on one road of socialism and independence against imperialism and true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the noble intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un, he added.
					
					 German Hermin Ferras Alvarez said in his speech that Cuba would as ever extend full support and encouragement to the just cause of the WPK and the Korean people for socialist construction and national reunification.
					
					 He sincerely hoped in the name of the Cuban party and government that the 7th Congress of the WPK would be an event to be specially recorded in its history.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Cuban Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Cuban Ambassador
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong met and had a talk with Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK German Hermin Ferras Alvarez who paid a farewell call on him on Thursday.

articles.title: Congratulations to Nigerian FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Nigerian FM
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a congratulatory message to Geoffrey Onyema on Wednesday upon his appointment as foreign minister of Nigeria.
					 The message wished him success in his new job to enhance the position and role of Nigeria in the international arenas, expressing belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future through mutual contacts and close cooperation between the two foreign ministries.

articles.title: Indonesian President Wishes Korean People Success in Building Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Indonesian President Wishes Korean People Success in Building Thriving Nation
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- An Kwang Il, DPRK ambassador to Indonesia, presented credentials to Joko Widodo, president of the Republic of Indonesia, on Nov. 13. 
					 The Indonesian president said he was pleased with the steady development of the bilateral relations of friendship. He wished the Korean people greater success in the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Ghanaian Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Ghanaian Ambassador
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Anani Okuminyi Demuyakor, Ghanaian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Here
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Here
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of Ulan Bator City of Mongolia led by Erdene Bat-Uul, governor and mayor of the city, arrived here on Thursday.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Leaves Here
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Leaves Here
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation led by Minister of Justice Alexandr Konovalov left here Thursday.
					 During its stay, the delegation toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, Mirae Scientists Street, etc.

articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Urges S. Korean Authorities to Show Their Will to Improve Inter-Korean Relations in Practice
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Urges S. Korean Authorities to Show Their Will to Improve Inter-Korean Relations in Practice
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) on Wednesday gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA as regards the south Korean authorities' floating of misinformation about the north-south dialogue:
					 The south Korean authorities recently created the impression that they were interested in the improvement of the inter-Korean relations, asserting that the "north kept mum" about the talks between authorities and crying out for a "response." Even the present chief executive jabbered that the "north's sincerity and will to implement the agreement were more important."
					
					 This is nothing but a revelation of their cynical ploy to shift the blame for having failed to hold north-south dialogue onto the DPRK.
					
					 As recognized by the world public, the DPRK initiated the north-south high-level emergency contact in last August and made every possible effort to sincerely implement the points agreed upon at the contact.
					
					 It was thanks to the positive and sincere efforts of the DPRK that the reunion of divided families and relatives took place at the Mt. Kumgang Resort days ago and non-governmental contacts and exchanges are being reenergized between the north and the south.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, however, are staging saber rattling with outsiders against the north almost everyday, denying their dialogue partner, and ratcheting up the anachronistic nuclear and "human rights" rackets against the north quite contrary to the unanimous will and desire of the compatriots for improved inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Even at this moment, the present chief executive of south Korea is busy with disgraceful diplomacy for soliciting "cooperation in the nuclear racket against the north" on foreign tours. The confrontation ruckus against the north such as the introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook being pushed forward for the purpose of inciting hostility towards the DPRK is going on in south Korea. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities are disturbing in every way even NGO exchange getting brisk according to the inter-Korean agreement by putting up unreasonable pretexts.
					
					 It goes without saying that all these acts are diametrically running counter to the spirit of the agreement and rattling the nerves of the dialogue partner.
					
					 As a matter of fact, there is no change in the attitude of the south Korean authorities before and after the August agreement.
					
					 No matter how loudly the south Korean authorities may talk about dialogue, no one would believe in their sincerity.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations cannot be repaired by the unilateral efforts.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly hope to see improved relations, they should stop making empty talk, discard their obstinate confrontation attitude and strive hard to create climate for dialogue, to begin with.
					
					 They would be well advised to keenly feel responsible for the failure to open inter-Korean dialogue and fulfill their commitment, though belatedly.

articles.title: Judicial and Procuratorial Organ Marks 70th Anniversary
articles.content:
Judicial and Procuratorial Organ Marks 70th Anniversary
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The Judicial and Procuratorial Organ of the DPRK marked its 70th founding anniversary. 
					 President Kim Il Sung had a deep insight into the position and role of the judicial and procuratorial organ in the revolution and construction and enunciated the Juche-oriented idea of law on this basis and established the precious tradition of its work. He declared the establishment of the organ on November 19, Juche 34 (1945). 
					
					 In the period of building a new country, the President clearly indicated the mission and duty of the judicial and procuratorial organ and provided a strong foundation of the revolutionary and popular judicial and procuratorial work by giving field guidance to its bodies in Pyongyang and local areas together with anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il developed in depth with his outstanding wisdom and scientific inquiry the revolutionary theory of Juche on the class struggle, people's democratic dictatorship, state and law in the socialist society put forward by the President and put the judicial and procuratorial work on a higher stage as required by the modeling of the whole society on Kimilsungism. 
					
					 Over the past seven decades the judicial and procuratorial organ has successfully fulfilled its sacred mission and role as protector of the leader, policies, social system and people under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 A national meeting took place at the Ponghwa Art Theatre on Thursday to mark the 70th founding anniversary of the organ.

articles.title: Frontrankers of Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement Tour Various Places
articles.content:
Frontrankers of Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement Tour Various Places
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The participants in the Fourth Meeting of Frontrankers of the Three-revolution Red Flag Movement visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They placed wreaths and flowers before the graves of Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik, grandparents of the President, and the graves of Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok, parents of the President, before paying silent tribute to them.
					
					 Then they visited Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum and the old home of the President where they looked round relics preserved there with much care.
					
					 They also visited the Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery on Mt. Taesong where they placed bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and paid silent tribute to her.
					
					 Then they toured the Three-Revolution Exhibition House, the historic site associated with the Fatherland Liberation War, Jangchon Vegetable Co-op Farm in Sadong District and Rungna Dolphinarium.

articles.title: 2015 Sci-Technical Symposium in Field of Greenhouse Vegetable Opens
articles.content:
2015 Sci-Technical Symposium in Field of Greenhouse Vegetable Opens
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- 2015 sci-technical symposium in the field of greenhouse vegetable opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute of the Academy of Agricultural Science on Thursday. 
					 The symposium will hear papers introducing successes and experience gained in settling scientific and technical issues arising in designing, construction and operation of vegetable greenhouses, production of seeds of greenhouse vegetables and their cultivation. It will involve a workshop, distribution of sci-technical books, video-show, etc. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kwak Pom Gi, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea; Kye Hui Nam, vice-chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea; Kye Yong Sam, president of the Academy of Agricultural Science; officials concerned, scientists, technicians and workers of greenhouse vegetable research institutes and production units from across the country. 
					
					 Ri Chol Man, vice-premier of the Cabinet and minister of Agriculture, made an opening address. 
					
					 The symposium will last till November 26.

articles.title: World Toilet Day Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
World Toilet Day Observed in DPRK
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A workshop on World Toilet Day took place at the Grand People's Study House on Thursday. 
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of Urban Management, Ministry of Public Health, Education Commission, the Grand People's Study House and other units and a staff member of the mission of UNICEF here.
					
					 Speakers recalled that social activities related to sanitation facilities are brisk worldwide.
					
					 They underscored the importance to introduce harmless sanitation facilities of new style helpful to the mental and physical development of the women and children in rural areas.
					
					 Its participants watched a science film dealing with techniques and methods of improving toilets in the countryside.

articles.title: Officials of Int'l Bodies Visit Public Health Organs
articles.content:
Officials of Int'l Bodies Visit Public Health Organs
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the missions of UNICEF and WHO Thursday visited public health organs on the Child Health Day. 
					 They went round clinics and people's hospitals in Pyongyang and local areas which provided various healthcares including application of different medicines good for the growth of children under 5.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Secondary Education of DPRK
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Secondary Education of DPRK
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Secondary schools in the DPRK have turned out a large number of talent reserves.
					 Typical of them is Kim Jong Suk Secondary School No. 1 in Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province.
					
					 Yun No Ul and An Sim Hyang, students of this school, came first and second at the national exhibition of children's science fictions and models held in Pyongyang in June.
					
					 The school had an honor of receiving thanks from leader Kim Jong Il four times and produced several prize winners of the International Math Olympiad.
					
					 This thrice Honored Red Flag school is now leading the country in a drive for improving the teaching method. Its advanced teaching methods are generalized widely in the field of secondary education.
					
					 The school has produced some 40 holders of academic degrees among its teachers and over 100 winners of July 15 Honor Student Prize among students.
					
					 And it has shown good results at national school contest, quick reading contest and exhibition of successes made in the education of gifted students every year.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Call for Independent Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Call for Independent Reunification
Tokyo, November 18 (KNS-KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Japan on Nov. 16 in commemoration of the 25th anniversary of the formation of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification.
					 Present at the seminar were So Chung On, director of the Department for International Affairs and Reunification of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon); Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification; and others, leading officials of Chongryon organizations and enterprises and other Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Members of the south Korean public organizations were also present there.
					
					 Choe Yong Hae, dean of Political Economy Faculty of Korean University in Japan, gave a lecture.
					
					 He said that the DPRK made efforts to tide over the situation on the peninsula that almost reached belligerency due to the moves of the south Korean military in August, stressing that the improvement of the north-south relations and peace and stability on the peninsula are very important.
					
					 The national meeting of reunification held in celebration of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation demonstrated the will of the Korean nation to wage a more dynamic struggle for national reunification, the speakers noted, declaring that the Koreans in Japan would play the role of a driving force in the reunification movement in the future, too in order to usher in the second June 15 era of reunification and the young Koreans, in particular, would stand in the van of the movement.
					
					 The seminar adopted an appeal calling on the Koreans at home and abroad to turn out in the drive for foiling the war moves of the hostile forces and paving a broad avenue to independent reunification in the spirit of by Korean nation itself and on the younger generation to take the lead in the movement for national reunification.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts U.S. and Hostile Forces' Slander on KCNA Website
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts U.S. and Hostile Forces' Slander on KCNA Website
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Forces hostile toward the DPRK including the U.S. shortly ago let loose a litany of outbursts slandering the website of the Korean Central News Agency.
					 They say the KCNA's website spread vicious code by way of letting subscribers download false executable software so as to hack their computers.
					
					 Ridiculous is the clumsy farce of swindlers to paint a prestigious media organization of the DPRK as a hacking group.
					
					 The story about "hacking" spread by the U.S. and its followers is sophism that does not stand to reason in view of media activities and lacks any convincing proof.
					
					 Media activities are social activities that use such media as internet, a product of modern science and technology, along with newspapers, magazines and broadcasting services.
					
					 If such valuable means indispensable for media activities lose confidence of the people, those activities will prove useless.
					
					 How can we use the websites we opened to disseminate the true picture of the DPRK prospering by dint of Songun politics and to contribute to accelerating the independence of the world for such mean purposes?
					
					 This may be possible in the U.S. ill-famed for immorality and depravity where misinformation is spread for a windfall and which wiretaps even allies for world domination. But such a thing is unimaginable at the dignified media organizations under socialism.
					
					 As for the software which the hostile forces took issue with, they are executable software needed for subscribers to have access to animation files. It is, therefore, normal.
					
					 What is questionable is that only the U.S. and south Korea are speaking ill of the software which is widely used by many people of the world. 
					
					 Those who spread the story about "hacking" are Radio Free Asia and other pseudo media.
					
					 Their manipulators are their authorities who are displeased with the stirring reality of the DPRK being known to the world and afraid of their criminal nature being brought to light.
					
					 In the final analysis, the recent "hacking" story cannot be construed otherwise than a premeditated plot of the hostile forces to stir up repugnancy towards the websites of the DPRK in the world community and bar the just voices of Songun Korea from being heard.
					
					 The U.S., chieftain of world cyber warfare, adopted it as its official policy to mount a preemptive attack without an advance warning on computer networks of other countries through the "presidential policy directive 20" in October 2012. Recently it held what it called an annual security consultative meeting with the south Korean authorities at which it cried out for intensifying joint cyber exercises and cyber military education targeting the DPRK. It is the height of impudence for it to talk about "hacking" by someone.
					
					 The U.S. is sadly mistaken if it thinks it can isolate the DPRK from the world and justify its criminal acts with such false story about "hacking".
					
					 Absurd and foolish rubbish will only touch off world derision and criticism of the tricksters.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers have to clearly understand that with nothing can they quell the just voices of great Songun Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Vigilance against Japan Keen to Emerge War State
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Vigilance against Japan Keen to Emerge War State
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are now claiming that the adoption of "security legislation" and their arms build-up are aimed at protecting Japan from someone's "threat".
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says that the world community recognizes that there is no country in the world that threatens Japan.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 News analysts are raising a question as to why Japan is so persistently beefing up its armed forces though there is no substantial threat to it.
					
					 In a word, Japan intends to reinvade Asia any time with huge armed forces.
					
					 It is an invariable ambition and strategic goal of the Japanese reactionaries to dominate Asia.
					
					 Japan has the precedent of sustaining a disgraceful defeat while working hard to realize its "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" aimed at dominating Asia during the Second World War.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries concede that Japan was defeated because it was weak in its military muscle.
					
					 Hence, they have put spurs to turning Japan into a major military power while beefing up its armed forces for decades. 
					
					 They calculate that in order to attain their goal they should steadily accumulate their military muscle for overseas invasion and create social climate and durable legal environment necessary for it. 
					
					 That's why they are advocating the validity of the "security legislation" and so frantically stepping up the arms-buildup. 
					
					 The reality requires every country not to slacken vigilance against Japan dreaming of a war of aggression but to keep a strict watch on it.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Responsible for Suppression of All-out People's Action: KCTU
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Responsible for Suppression of All-out People's Action: KCTU
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions on Nov. 15 issued a statement assailing the minister of Justice for his reckless remarks that the leading participants in the all-out people's action staged in Seoul should be severely punished, according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					 What he uttered was a signal for intensifying the power's crackdown and domination, the statement said, and went on: 
					
					 The regime is to wholly blame for the savage suppression of the all-out people's action.

articles.title: S. Korean Protesters Demand Apology for Police Brutal Suppression
articles.content:
S. Korean Protesters Demand Apology for Police Brutal Suppression
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Leading members of organizations including the headquarters for all-out people's action, the south Korean Federation of Peasants Associations, the Solidarity for Progress and the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions launched a sit-in outside the Hospital of Seoul National University on Nov. 17.
					 Prior to the sit-in, they held a press conference.
					
					 They denounced the police for firing tear liquid at the protestors during the all-out people's action, putting a peasant in a critical condition.
					
					 This was a deliberate attempt to kill people, they charged. 
					
					 They demanded the president make personal apology for this brutal crackdown and dismiss the chief of the Police Agency.
					
					 They warned their sit-in would go on till their demands are met.
					
					 The Democratic People's Action also held a similar press conference on the same day.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Demands Punishment of Chief of Police Agency
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Demands Punishment of Chief of Police Agency
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People on Wednesday in an editorial denounced the chief of the Police Agency of south Korea for shamelessly behaving after brutally  suppressing protesters. 
					 The editorial said:
					
					 The chief of the Police Agency now under strong fire by the people for ordering the brutal suppression of the all-out people's action said at a meeting organized by the "Saenuri Party" the police searched the person and body that led the "illegal" demo and applied for warrants of arrest, threatening people. He made no apology for the tragedy in which a peasant in his 60s is in a critical condition after being wounded by water cannon fire. 
					
					 The chief of the Police Agency remains unfazed as he is patronized by the prime minister and the minister of Justice who have no elementary sense of human rights and the gangsters of the ruling party who claim that "police's killing of citizens is regarded as justifiable in the U.S." 
					
					 It demanded that the chief of the Police Agency be fired and punished for being chieftain of bestial suppression.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Group Gets Frantic in Suppressing Participants in All-out People's Action
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Group Gets Frantic in Suppressing Participants in All-out People's Action
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative forces are kicking up a whirlwind of wholesale suppression of the participants in the all-out people's action which took place on Nov. 14. 
					 The floor leader of the "Saenuri Party" on Nov. 15 branded the all-out people's action as an "extreme violent demonstration" and "illegal violent demonstration," adding that "it can never be justified."
					
					 Not content with crying out for legal responsibility of the demonstrators, he said "resolute tracking of dishonest forces and agitation forces is needed," an attempt to kick up a new racket for suppressing the "forces following the north."
					
					 The spokesman for the "Saenuri Party" also cried out for severely handling the violent rally.
					
					 Encouraged by this, the police decided to summon and investigate representatives of over 40 organizations that took part in the action.
					
					 It is also investigating 49 out of over 50 whom they walked off while suppressing the action.

articles.title: S. Korean Farmers' Organizations Denounce Police's Brutal Suppression
articles.content:
S. Korean Farmers' Organizations Denounce Police's Brutal Suppression
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Peasants Associations, the Federation of Women Peasants Associations and the Catholic Peasants Association of south Korea held a press conference outside the Police Agency building on November 16 in protest against the fascist police's brutal suppression of the all-out people's action, according to south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People. 
					 The fascist police brutally suppressed people from all walks of life who turned out in the all-out people's action in Seoul on Nov. 14 by indiscriminately firing tear liquid at the masses. 
					
					 This crackdown left many people wounded. 
					
					 The organizations in the press conference urged the chief executive to make an apology to the people for the bestial suppression and dismiss the chief of the Police Agency. 
					
					 They warned that they would continue the action at any sacrifice and develop it into popular resistance.

articles.title: Bird Flu Breaks out in South Jolla Province in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Breaks out in South Jolla Province in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Bird flu broke out again in Ryongam County, South Jolla Province, according to the south Korean MBC on Wednesday. 
					 A duck infected with bird flu was found in a farm house in the county on Nov. 13. 
					
					 The bird flu broke out in Ryongam County on October 18 and it is rapidly spreading in different parts of South Jolla Province.

articles.title: Support and Solidarity for Korean People's Struggle Voiced by Russians
articles.content:
Support and Solidarity for Korean People's Struggle Voiced by Russians
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- We extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to carry out the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 This was expressed in the statement adopted at the inaugural ceremony of the committee for remembering Comrade Kim Jong Il held in Nakhodka, Russia on November 14.
					
					 The statement noted:
					
					 Upholding the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il firmly defended the socialist cause and turned the DPRK into a political and ideological power and military power possessed of nuclear weapons by pursuing Songun politics.
					
					 This was the greatest exploits he performed and serves as a powerful driving force enabling the DPRK to weather any difficulty and trial.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are achieving amazing successes in building a thriving socialist nation as they are equipped with the spirit of defending the leader unto death and the revolutionary soldier spirit.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea, army and people are closely rallied behind the leader.
					
					 The cause of Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We boundlessly revere Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the great leaders, and will always remember their undying feats.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Will Shine Long: Russian Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Will Shine Long: Russian Figure
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il is alive in the hearts of not only the Koreans but the world progressives and his great exploits will shine long. 
					 Zelenov, first secretary of the Nakhodka City Committee of the Maritime Territory of Russia, said this at a ceremony of forming the committee for remembering Comrade Kim Jong Il held in Nakhodka on November 14.
					
					 He said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il successfully carried forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Kim Jong Il firmly defended the socialist cause even though socialism collapsed in several countries.
					
					 His idea and cause are shedding more brilliant rays thanks to respected Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Un the Korean people are demonstrating the invincibility and might of socialism before the whole world.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Nakhodka, Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Nakhodka, Russia
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering Comrade Kim Jong Il was formed in Nakhodka, Russia on November 14.
					 Zelenov, first secretary of the Nakhodka City Committee of the Maritime Territory of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in UK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in UK
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A British committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed on November 14.
					 Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee set the remembrance period from November 16 to December 17 and decided to give wide publicity to the exploits performed by Kim Jong Il through media and to organize political and cultural events including seminar, remembrance meeting and film show.

articles.title: S. African Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed
articles.content:
S. African Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The South African Committee for Remembering Comrade Kim Jong Il was formed with due ceremony on Nov. 14.
					 Bonakele Majuba, secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of South Africa and chairman of the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il on the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					
					 A message to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony.

articles.title: CC de PTC ofrece banquete en honor de German Hermin Ferras Alvarez
articles.content:
CC de PTC ofrece banquete en honor de German Hermin Ferras Alvarez
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea ofrecio el dia 19 un banquete en honor de German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Cuba en Corea.
					Fueron invitados alli el matrimonio del embajador e integrantes de la sede diplomatica cubana en Corea.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el secretario Kim Yang Gon, el subjefe de departamento Pak Kun Gwang y otros funcionarios del CC del PTC.
					
					Kim Yang Gon menciono en su discurso que hoy tambien se fortalecen y se desarrollan las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion, basadas en especial camaraderia de los lideres antecedentes de dos paises.
					
					En adelante tambien, marcharemos hombro con hombro con los companeros cubanos en el mismo camino para la independencia antiimperialista y el socialismo en acato al legado de los grandes Lideres y el noble proposito del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, subrayo.
					
					German Hermin Ferras Alvarez dijo en su discurso subrayo que en el futuro tambien, Cuba enviara irrestricto apoyo y respaldo a la justa causa del PTC y el pueblo coreano para la construccion socialista y la reunificacion del pais.
					
					El embajador cubano deseo en nombre del partido y el gobierno de Cuba que el VII Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea sea un acontecimiento digno de registrarse en la historia del partido.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador de Ghana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador de Ghana
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Anani Okuminyi Demuyakor presento el dia 19 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Ghana en Corea.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Miembros de UNICEF y OMS visitan organismos de salud publica
articles.content:
Miembros de UNICEF y OMS visitan organismos de salud publica
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de la salud de la infancia, los miembros del Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF) y la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud (OMS) en Corea visitaron el dia 19 varios organismos de la salud Publica.
					Los huespedes hicieron recorrido por varias clinicas y hospitales populares de la ciudad de Pyongyang y otras localidades donde vieron a los ninos menores de 5 anos de edad tomando las medicinas favorables al crecimiento y presenciaron otros servicios medicos.

articles.title: CRPP demanda a autoridades surcoreanas mostrar voluntad de mejorar relaciones N-S
articles.content:
CRPP demanda a autoridades surcoreanas mostrar voluntad de mejorar relaciones N-S
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ACNC) -- A la pregunta formulada por la ACNC en relacion con que las autoridades surcoreanas sueltan tonterias sobre el problema del dialogo entre ambas partes coreanas, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) dio el dia 18 la siguiente respuesta.
					En estos dias, las autoridades surcoreanas dicen que "el Norte se mantiene callado" y "no responde nada" en cuanto a las conversaciones entre autoridades de ambas partes coreanas y hasta la actual mandataria habla de que "son mas importantes la sinceridad y la voluntad practica del Norte" como si ellas tuvieran interes en la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Esto no pasa de ser una muestra de intento malsano de imputar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea las responsabilidades de no haber realizado el dialogo N-S.
					
					Como saben todos, en agosto ultimo la RPDC preparo con iniciativa el contacto urgente de alto rango entre ambas partes coreanas y vino haciendo todo lo posible para ejecutar los articulos del acuerdo logrado en el contacto.
					
					Hace poco, en el monte Kumgang tuvo lugar el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados y se activan de modo paulatino el contacto y el intercambio a nivel civil N-S, lo que es el resultado de los esfuerzos activos y sinceros de la RPDC.
					
					Sin embargo, a contrapelo de la voluntad y el anhelo de todos los coreanos aspirantes a la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas, las autoridades surcoreanas niegan a su contraparte de dialogo, desarrollan cotidianamente los ejercicios militares en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras y arman anacronicos alborotos nucleares y "derechos humanos" anti-RPDC.
					
					Ahora tambien, en el extranjero la mandataria surcoreana mendiga a las fuerzas foraneas la "cooperacion en el problema nuclear del Norte" y en tanto, en el interior del Sur de Corea se desarrollan la aplicacion del "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno" cuyo motivo es inculcar la hostilidad a la RPDC y otros alborotos de confrontacion fratricida.
					
					Ademas, bajo pretextos injustos, las autoridades surcoreanas impiden de toda manera el intercambio civil que se desarrolla favorablemente conforme al acuerdo N-S.
					
					Todo esto es indudablemente una violacion flagrante del espiritu del acuerdo N-S y una incitacion a su interlocutor.
					
					Francamente dicho, antes y despues del acuerdo de agosto no hay ningun cambio en la actitud de las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					?Quien creera en la sinceridad de las autoridades surcoreanas aunque ellas hablan mucho del dialogo?
					
					Las relaciones intercoreanas no se mejoran solo por los esfuerzos de una parte.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas quieren de veras la mejora de relaciones N-S, deben abandonar su invariable actitud conflictiva y esforzarse por crear el ambiente favorable a l dialogo.
					
					Al sentir vivamente las responsabilidades de no haber realizado el dialogo N-S, las autoridades surcoreanas deben hacer lo que merece.

articles.title: ACNC condena complot anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y sus satelites
articles.content:
ACNC condena complot anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y sus satelites
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, Estados Unidos y las fuerzas hostiles difamaron gravemente el sitio web de la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea.
					Insisten en que la ACNC realiza hacking contra las ordenadoras de los suscriptores con el metodo de bajar los programas falsos desde el sitio web falso y divulgar los codigos malignos.
					
					Todo el mundo esta consternado ante tal complot de los estafadores tendente a tildar al digno medio de prensa de la RPDC de supuesta entidad de hacking.
					
					Tal falsificacion de EE.UU. y sus satelites no conviene a los principios de las actividades de prensa y deviene un sofisma carente de pruebas reales.
					
					Las actividades de prensa se realizan por conducto del periodico, revista, radio y varios medios como el internet, fruto de la ciencia y tecnica de punta.
					
					Si tales medios valiosos imprescindibles para las actividades de prensa pierden el credito de las amasas, sus actividades seran inutiles.
					
					Entonces, ?es posible que la ACNC pueda cometer hacking, acto maligno, por medio de sitios web, abiertos en aras de dar a conocer el aspecto de la RPDC que se prospera bajo la politica de Songun y a adelantar la independencia mundial?
					
					EE.UU., pais corrupto divulga con frecuencia las informaciones falsas para ganar mucho dinero e intercepta hasta a sus aliados a fin de tomar hegemonia mundial.
					
					Pero, son inimaginables tales actos en los prestigiosos medios de prensa de la RPDC.
					
					Los programas cuestionados por las fuerzas hostiles son los practicos necesarios a la lectura de video, los cuales son normales.
					
					Tenemos duda de que solo EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea difaman los programas que se usan favoritamente por numerosos visitantes del mundo.
					
					Los criminales que difundieron el rumor de "hacking", son la Radio Asia Libre de Estados Unidos y otros seudos medios de prensa.
					
					Sus manipuladores son las autoridades que temen que la realidad radiante de Corea socialita se extienda por el mundo y se revele su naturaleza criminal.
					
					En una palabra, la farsa de la informacion de "hacking" deviene la maniobra intrigante intencional de las fuerzas hostiles encaminada a obstaculizar la voz justa de la Corea del Songun creando el sentimiento negativo internacional sobre los sitios web de la RPDC.
					
					A traves de la "orden de politica del presidente 20" despachada en octubre de 2012, EE.UU. politizo el ataque preventivo sin advertencia  contra las redes de computadoras de otros paises y en los ultimos anos convoco con las autoridades surcoreanas la supuesta reunion anual de consulta de seguridad para intensificar el entrenamiento conjunto cibernetico y la educacion militar cibernetica  contra la RPDC.
					
					Este maldito del mundo cibernetico habla ilogicamente sobre "hacking" de alguien.
					
					Si EE.UU. piensa en que pueda aislar a la RPDC del mundo y justificar su crimen con el absurdo rumor de "hacking", es una  gran equivocacion.
					
					Los disparates absurdos aumentaran solo la burla y la censura del mundo.
					
					EE.UU. y las fuerzas aliadas deben tener presente que no pueden impedir con nada la voz justa de la gran Corea del Songun.
